author: andreassosilo
title: Cardano Hub Indonesia - Workshops
description: A adoção do criptograma indonésio está ocorrendo agora, mas as pessoas ainda ++precisam sobre Cardano & é Ecosystem++ (Catalyst, Plutus, Atala PRISM, etc.)

f6_assessments.q0: It is argued that although the Indonesian society has demonstrated interest and growth, the vast majority of people are unaware of the Cardano ecosystem. In order to resolve this problem, he proposes to create a community that organizes periodic workshops in the language, led by locals. I find these seven success metrics partially adequate, in that they are defined in some cases in a concrete manner, for example, "Introduce new users to Cardano" and in other cases they are very diffuse, for example, "Drive adoption of Cardano technology". However, no targets were provided for each of the metrics, which makes the impact assessment less objective and makes it difficult to assess the impact in a precise manner.
f6_assessments.q1: Three individuals are on the team, experiences and skills are described, references are provided for two of them for verification. There is sufficient information provided to enable the reader to comprehend what the plan is and what needs to be accomplished for a successful implementation. Evidence of 3 workshops during 2021 is presented. The budget is broken down into 9 distinct items so that you can understand how the amounts are allocated. This type of project tends to have a high abandonment rate, so it would have been excellent to address this and other factors that threaten the viability of this proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: The team provides strong evidence to help improve the auditability assessment. Workshops have been held in the past, and they have also informed us where summaries and evidence of each event will be posted, along with links to the various social media. Presented is a summary of the plans for three, six, and twelve months, along with a description of the events that will be planned. Although the success metrics provided are defined, they do not have associated targets, which will make it difficult for the community to determine whether or not they are being successful.

f6_assessments.q0: I think they have addressed the challenge well. This category is for community hubs and they gave a great idea for building a community hub. The only reason I did not give it 5 is I cannot really tell from the proposal how this can scale or what kind of impact this might have. If we are expecting 5 to 10 people, it might not be the best use of community funds vs if they are reaching 100s of people. By including those details, I think it would have helped the voters understand if this is something they would like to fund. Still very good though.
f6_assessments.q1: Overall it looks like a strong team. Not sure if one of them will be doing the actual presentations or if they are hiring another person to do it. While they have a lot of experience in organizing communities, they do not all have a lot of shown techincial experience which would make them an authority on blockchain or Cardano and be able to teach it. I wouldn't be surprised if they do, but I would have liked to see that information included in the proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: I think that this team did a great job by creating a section on auditability and how they intend to address this aspect of it. And they have included some information that we can use to audit against it. Ideally, I would have liked to have some more details here though. They define that they want to hold 24 meetings and say that they will upload the support for people to view which is great. But It is still lacking other details for us to guage the progress and success. Things like how many people they would like the have attending these would go a long way. Holding two meetings a month is good and can be measured against, but Would love to see them comment on how many members attending these events would be considered a success. The same goes for the metrics they have provided. I would like if these quantified everything that is mentioned so it can be easily measured against. But still, think that they made a very good effort here.

f6_assessments.q0:
People in Indonesia still lack awareness about Cardano and its ecosystem. The vision for this challenge is clear, and the results it brings can be very beneficial for Cardano.
There is clarity in the description of the problem and the solution presented, the proposal is appropriate to the challenge. Building the Cardano Indonesia Community by providing information and knowledge through seminars hosted by Indonesian collaborators
f6_assessments.q1:
There is no doubt about the ability of this team to execute successfully. They are veteran and experienced members of the Cardano community in Indonesia. We can easily check their information according to the LinkedIn they provide. The proposal gives a blueprint as well as provides links to the results they have been implemented to develop the Cardano ecosystem
To further increase the probability of this proposal's success, it would be good if the proposal measures the challenges and risks that may be encountered.
f6_assessments.q2:
All deliverables are specific, stages provide clear dates so progress can be tracked, and results can be evaluated by the community based on the data generated.
I strongly agree that the suggested data and success criteria are accurate for measuring challenge progress. The budget was very well thought out and presented very clearly.

f6_assessments.q0: The Cardano Hub Indonesia-workshops proposal will increase more Cardano adoption in the Indonesian community. It fits well within the challenge of scaling up Cardano's community hub.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer is a Cardano ambassador and active within Indonesian community. He got his 2 team members who are local and communities coordinators. The rate for host, speaker and video editor are in line with the market rate. The proposal shows roadmap of 1 year and the KPIs which should be attainable. They would have gotten the better rank if they include risk/challenges that might hinder the implementation in the proposal and adjust their KPIs to have more impact.
f6_assessments.q2: Having said that, the information is sufficient to audit the success of proposal. If the KPIs will be revised to a slightly higher level, this will be an impactful proposal. The KPIs give the milestone in term of number proposals, CAs, VCAs but the number could have been revised upward for the proposal to be considered successful.

f6_assessments.q0: This is a proposal on organizing blockchain-related seminars and events in Indonesia. It is practical and encouraging activity. This is to expand the accessibility of blockchain to a large number of users in the community.
f6_assessments.q1: In the content of the proposal, I see that this is an experienced team, but it is necessary to specify the member information as well as the relevant experience history of all team members. Indo is a strong community, developed in technology and quite open to crypto, so the project is possible.
f6_assessments.q2: As for seminars and events, it is quite easy to check KPIs through video materials provided and endorsed by the community.

f6_assessments.q0: I believe that this idea is needed for the development of Cardano in Indonesia. Organizing activities to help educate people there is what affects the Cardano ecosystem further. Moreover, the team put some promising metrics and goals that I believe it suit with what the challenge given.
f6_assessments.q1: The team already held 3 workshops in 2021 that attached links in the proposal. So, no doubt that they can do it further. In this proposal, they share a vision and detailed action plan with target, activities, discussion topics... that is very clear. They have a well-explanation about what will happen in those events that helps the roadmap make sense. About the budget, is reasonable with their roadmap and fields, positions that need to develop the idea.
f6_assessments.q2:
The team has enough roadmap detail and key metrics that help to audit their plan easily. 
They also have a good vision of the problem context and have a detailed explanation about their solution that addresses it. Look into the detail of this proposal, they also describe how they scale this model to many. And that makes their plan have a big potency to the development of Cardano in Indonesia. .

f6_assessments.q0: The project on communication, user education easier access to the cardano platform and a deeper and more in-depth understanding of the platform's terminology. The team has certain experience in organizing events related to the crypto community.
f6_assessments.q1: This is one of the educational communication projects that the cardano community around the world is quite enthusiastic about implementing and proposing at this time. Although not too creative, these are also necessary events due to the high practicality of implementation.
f6_assessments.q2: Through the documentation provided through videos and construction documents in Indonesian, it is possible to check the project progress, how far the KPI has been, and summarize the impact of the proposal on the community.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal should become an integral part of the big Cardano Indonesia ecosystem in these proposals, https://cardano.ideascale.com/a/dtd/Cardano-Hub-Indonesia-Video-Series/381604-48088 and https://cardano.ideascale.com/a/dtd/Community-Web-Portal-in-Indonesian/381632-48088. This workshop will have a real knowledge/experience sharing between the members with live interactions. Thus, members can have a supportive atmosphere to learn and increase Cardano's adoption.
f6_assessments.q1: In terms of the budget plan and time frame, it's clearly defined. One thing to note is the accuracy of the materials. Will there be any evaluations or feedbacks to workshop materials? It's important not to share misleading information/experiences. The proposers need to make sure the speaker delivers the material as expected. By getting support from other ecosystem proposals, the success likelihood of this project is very high.
f6_assessments.q2: The audit process of this proposal is clear and can be checked via the official YouTube channel based on the workshops' schedule. These videos later can be shared with a broader audience outside the Cardano ecosystem or non-crypto users. With this, it's in our best interest to show people what kind of positive contribution this community has to introduce crypto and blockchain, especially Cardano blockchain.

f6_assessments.q0: Proposer address the challenge very well, with great problem statement and solution given. The proposal also address a basic and needed action within the Indonesia community through knowledge building - via simple continuous workshops
f6_assessments.q1: Strongly agreed, the proposer give detailed plan and the team also came from Cardano Foundation, EHT and Indonesian Community.  They also already done successful workshop in the past that confirms this proposal is executable.
f6_assessments.q2: Proposer give clear target and deliverables yet simple to audit by the community. Using Cardano forum as the medium to report the progress showing the spirit of transparency in decentralized space.

f6_assessments.q0:
"Providing information & knowledge via workshops to grow the Cardano community in Indonesia is a great idea. Indonesia is a developing country in Southeast Asia, so the development of cardano in Indonesia is also what Cardano is aiming for. 

Creating workshops to provide information and knowledge will help Indonesians better understand Cardano so that Cardano can be developed in Southeast Asian countries where Cardano can be a good solution to their problems. By the way, this proposal also aim to raise more CA and vCA for Catalyst. That would be great for Catalyst too."
f6_assessments.q1:
"With the number of workshops being held, 2 workshops per month is a very feasible thing. In addition, The team behind this proposal is undoubtfully highly qualified. As a Cardano ambassador in Indonesia, the team was able to successfully complete the planned workshops.

Also, with existing communities in indonesia, this team can reach large number of people interested in Cardano easily.

However, in this proposal, only one member of the team is listed and 'with the help of other Cardano Indonesia Community Members, as host, speaker, video editor, etc' does not specifically show what is Cardano Indonesia Community Members' experience and what is their specific job"
f6_assessments.q2:
"The proposing team properly outlines the activity roadmap and the way, progress and success can be audited. 

The resulting costs are very reasonable and auditing is easy in this case. 

Every successful workshop can be tracked via the Meetup account and Youtube channel. That is an easy way to keep track their job."

f6_assessments.q0: this is an interesting idea. It will build a stronger Cardano Indonesia Community by providing materials and teaching newcomers to cardano by a blockchain education center and curriculum development teach is useful in teaching people in Indonesia who are interested in learning. But now I'm a bit confused that newbies have to learn on their own? Or is there someone on the team that will teach or mentor them from the start? .Hope the author clarify this issue
f6_assessments.q1: This proposed group includes a fairly comprehensive list of team members and links to the author to support the author's claims of experience. I believe that with your experience statements Ambassador Cardano, Eastern Hemisphere City Hall Team Members, Catalyst School Extension Team Members, Cardano Hub Jakarta Meeting Organizers will be able to create meetups and share knowledge for new members to access to the cardano.community the plan is presented in an easy to understand way but I think you should add some challenges when the pandemic situation is so stressful, when creating an online event about the pros and cons.
f6_assessments.q2: This proposal is missing several important issues such as: an estimate of the time to produce the content, a roadmap for specific validation timelines, the implementation date when your project will start running, and the projected date for the project. The project date is February 6, 2022, and the KPIs determine the success of the project. I suggest you add it to your project, and change How does success looks like to a roadmap that will make sense  than.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal addresses the challenge very effectively and delivers a thorough plan to build Cardano Indonesia community starting with Jakarta, while delivering documentation and relevant experiences of all project team adding the chance of this project being scaled and replicated in other city. The adoption of crypto in Indonesia is happening but the people are still not well informed about Cardano and its ecosystem. Providing information and knowledge through workshops by Indonesian collaborators will sure be an effective way to answer the problem. However, it will be interesting to know how the team wants to bring this project further in the future. Getting other blockchain communities onboard will surely help the acceleration of project scalability.
f6_assessments.q1: Given the combined experience presented by its team member, it is highly likely that the project can be a huge success. Deliverables, timeframe, and goals of this project are very achievable. Furthermore, the team provides milestones and detailed roadmap for three, six, and twelve months and requested a reasonable budget. Problem statement and solution delivered match and both address the challenge effectively. The only concern is on the continuation of Cardano educational workshop 1 year may depend on additional sponsorship which the team also stated in the proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: The workshops video will be posted on meetup account which can give full and open auditability. Additionally, he will also post the summary of each event in 🇮🇩 Cardano Forum and upload video of the workshop in Cardano Indonesia Official YouTube Channel that open for anyone to verify. Success criteria are relevant and feasible, making it not only auditable but also realistic. However, the team can improve the execution of this project by posting the detailed budget spending on cardano forum so it can be audited by the community member.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal addresses the problem about Cardano's adoption and awareness in Indonesia. It addresses this challenge by providing information and knowledge via workshops for Indonesian people. This proposal provides the workshop syllabus and goals, which is to educate the community in Indonesia. The syllabus is well structured and clear, proven that the proposer knows what is needed to add more values into the Cardano ecosystem. By having these workshops, it will bring awareness to Cardano itself, and it will further drive adoption through exploration and ideas from the community in the future.
f6_assessments.q1: This proposal provides a well thought out plan on how to implement and run these workshops. The budget have been broken down into details (hours, number of people involved, etc.), which proven the ability of the proposer to identify the type of team members needed, as well as what resources are needed. With the clear and laid out 12 months roadmap, it looks feasible to complete this in a timely manner. However, it would be more reassuring if the proposer already have a dedicated team beforehand, that can be proven about their experience in handling these work. By depending only on community members along the way, there will be no guarantee to a successful and/or quality workshop because we don't know what kind of people will be working on this. My suggestion is to at least provide additional information on how these people from community member is chosen, such as what prior experience needed to become speaker, marketer, designer, etc. This is the risk that the proposer may have overlooked as I don't see any further explanation on this.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposer provides a clear 12 months roadmap with their goals and expected result. To achieve those goals, this proposal provides 12 topics for each workshop. This prove that the proposer knows what the problems and the solutions are. Every workshop will be publicly available on the Meetup platform, and they will also post the summary of each event in the Cardano Forum. By considering these points, it will make tracking the progress easier and transparent to the community.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal answers the challenge appropriately. The proposal aiming to introduce Cardano and its ecosystem to Indonesian people with creating community hub and educational workshops. Inviting new people to join the community with educational workshops will further increase their interest in joining something new. Contents of the workshops are well-structured, it will add more knowledges for the Indonesian people about Cardano and its ecosystem. Checking the discord channel, the community already have 220+ member and actively sharing.
f6_assessments.q1: References, links, realistic timetable and other evidence are enough to make sure this proposal is legit. There's something bother me in the budget-team correlation. Proposer only listed one person in the proposal while the budget for Project Coordinator, Host, Speaker asking $4080 in total. I think it is too much if the project coordinator can do a double or triple job as Host & Speaker. I suggest to detailing down the team members with specific job, because in discord channel the community have 4 Team Members and 2 Moderators (example: John & Jane speaker at Week 1, Mary with the Dev background will be speaker at Week 3).
f6_assessments.q2: This proposal is auditable, but... Proposer give enough link to their past workshop and community hub, while we can not tracking the milestones yet (new proposer / new CA or vCA after succesful workshop). I suggest to make updates for tracking achievements of the program. It can be updates on Instagram post or highlights, pinned topic in Cardano Forum, etc.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal has provide clear problem within the challenge which need to be solved. In Jakarta, if you asked people what is Cardano maybe 1 in 10 people know about Cardano or maybe blockchain itself. This is the prove that this will add a lot of value in Cardano ecosytem.  Lastly, it is clearly scalable.
f6_assessments.q1: This proposal provide the credential needed to conduct a preliminary assessment of this proposers capacity to archive on their deliverable. The proposal also provide verifiable plan in this regard.  The budget is very crystal clear on how it will be used on what this proposal seeks to archive.
f6_assessments.q2: This proposal has given sufficient data and most likely archive the  intended deliverables. Roadmaps, KPI, correlation between problem and solution is explained in detail.

f6_assessments.q0: Wonderful proposal as the community growth is the biggest asset to a project. A steonger community and one that inspire others to develop and grow in the ecosystem will drive the use of Cardano network and it's use cases.
f6_assessments.q1: Based on current and previous workshop links it appears that the experience is there to kickstart this plan and deliver the solution appropriately. As mentioned the success from this plan can be onboarded on other regions and expand in volume.
f6_assessments.q2: The key metrics, KPIs, timelines and funding uses are quite clear and transparent. The plan is well structured.

f6_assessments.q0: Problem statement being increasing  awareness about Cardona and Cardona's Ecosystem in Indonesia. The proposer is trying to increase the knowledge about Cardona's Ecosystem by conducting workshops in their local language and also build a community around it. This will be very helpful to educate people about the Cardona and understand it's importance.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposer in the proposal has mentioned about them having experience being Cardano Ambassador and also performing various roles this experience should be enough to carry out the proposal successfully.
They have also provide a detailed step by step timeline on what are the things to be done and time duration for each things hence it very possible that the proposal will be carried out successfully
f6_assessments.q2: The proposer has provided a complete fund breakdown and also a detailed timeline of things to be done this should be enough to audit the progress of the proposal and The proposer has also provided a link for forum and their channel where they would post updates about their events which will be very help to track the progress and success of the proposal. Hence sufficient information has been provided to audit the proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: The problem of lack of awareness of Cardano and it's ecosystem in Indonesia is well presented and the team offers an excellent solution in this proposal. This project and similar projects definitely have a positive impact on the Cardano ecosystem. The team clearly and precisely states how this project will add value to the Cardano and Catayst ecosystem. The KPIs presented by the team in this proposal match the KPIs listed in the challenge. The proposal is excellent and is  able to scale and address future challenges.
f6_assessments.q1: This team of three people in proposal provides all the necessary information/links from which their work so far can be seen. Transparency via LinkedIn proves that this team has all the necessary skills, knowledge and experience to deliver on the proposal and to implement the proposal. The budget is outlined clearly, understandable and it's broken down into identifiable items. So far, the proposal has been made perfectly. The amount requested is reasonable to achieve the set goals. The team in the proposal explains in detail the detailed implementable plan and the details of the actionable tasks and the order of execution are also clearly and perfectly presented. Does this proposal have a flaw? The team states the elaborated time frames through which the work can be realistically completed. The team in the proposal lists all the necessary resources and technical aspects that are crucial for implementation. The team states the elaborated time frames needed in order for the work to be realistically completed. The team in the proposal lists all the necessary resources and technical aspects that are crucial for implementation. I did come across one flaw though. It would be good if the proposal listed possible risks. It would be good as everything covered in the proposal to cover the idea of possible risks and offer solutions if risks arise.
f6_assessments.q2: Without exaggeration, this proposal is space shuttle. The roadmap with milestones and the time horizon for achievement are also perfectly elaborated. KPIs are excellent presented and they make sense and can be used to quantify the success of the project. With a team of people like this and a proposal made in this way, the community can be in ecstasy and can easily track this project.

solution: Construir a Comunidade Cardano Indonésia, fornecendo informações e conhecimentos através de workshops, liderados pelos próprios colaboradores indonésios.
experience: Cardano Embaixador, Membro da Equipe da Prefeitura do Hemisfério Leste, Membro da Equipe de Extensão da Escola Catalítica, Cardano Hub Jakarta Organizador do Meetup
